articleList.title: Edward P. Jones’s Carefully Quantified Literary World
articleList.desc: In the second installment of 'The Americans', his series on overlooked or under-read writers, A.O. Scott considers the scrupulously documented, meticulously observed fiction of Edward P. Jones.

articleList.title: Why the Working Class Votes Against Its Economic Interests
articleList.desc: Two new books, Robert B. Reich’s “The System” and Zephyr Teachout’s “Break ’Em Up,” examine the impact of economic inequality in America.

articleList.title: How the Battle for Women’s Suffrage Played Out in the Pages of the Book Review
articleList.desc: What did our critics think of the histories, memoirs and novels that explored the road to the 19th Amendment?
